1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdVersion.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
11   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The Tcl module-version routine which provides the    **
14   |  **			definition of symbolic version names and the module- **
15   |  **			alias command providing the definition of module and **
16   |  **			version aliases					     **
17   |  ** 									     **
18   |  **   Exports:		cmdModuleVersion				     **
19   |  **			cmdModuleAlias					     **
20   |  **			CleanupVersion					     **
21   |  **			AliasLookup					     **
22   |  **			ExpandVersions					     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  **   Notes:	This module defines the callback functions for the defi-     **
25   |  **		nition of symbolic module names and module aliases. The      **
26   |  **		syntax of the according commands is defined as:		     **
27   |  ** 									     **
28   |  **	    Module-Versions:						     **
29   |  **		module-version <module>/<version> <name> [ <name> ... ]	     **
30   |  **		module-version /<version> <name> [ <name> ... ]		     **
31   |  **		module-version <module> <name> [ <name> ... ]		     **
32   |  **		module-version <alias> <name> [ <name> ... ]		     **
33   |  ** 									     **
34   |  **	    Module-Alias:						     **
35   |  **		module-alias <alias> <module>/<version>			     **
36   |  **		module-alias <alias> /<version>				     **
37   |  **		module-alias <alias> <module>				     **
38   |  **		module-alias <alias> <alias>				     **
39   |  ** 									     **
40   |  ** 									     **
41   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
42   |  ****/
43   | 
44   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
45   |  ** 									     **
46   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
47   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
48   |  ** 									     ** 
49   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
50   | 
51   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdVersion.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:33 rkowen Exp $";
52   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
53   | 
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | 
58   | #include "modules_def.h"
59   | 
60   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
61   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | 
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | /**									     **/
66   | /**   The whole thing is handled in memory. The structure is build of module **/
67   | /**   and name records. There are 3 types of name records: version, name     **/
68   | /**   and alias. 							     **/
69   | /**									     **/
70   | /**         |                                                    |	     **/
71   | /**     +---+---+<-------------------------------+           +---+---+	     **/
72   | /**     | module| ------------------------+      |           | alias |	     **/
73   | /**     +---+---+ --------+               |      |           +-------+	     **/
74   | /**         |   ^    +----+----+          |      |               |	     **/
75   | /**         |   +--- | version |       +--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
76   | /**         |   |    +----+----+       | name|---+     <-----| alias |	     **/
77   | /**         |   |         |            +--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
78   | /**         |   |    +----+----+          |      |               |	     **/
79   | /**         |   +--- | version |------>+--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
80   | /**         |   |    +----+----+<-+--- | name|---+           | alias |	     **/
81   | /**         |   |         |       | +- +--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
82   | /**         |   |    +----+----+  | |     |      |               |	     **/
83   | /**         |   +--- | version |  | |  +--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
84   | /**         |   |    +----+----+  | |  | name|---+     <-----| alias |	     **/
85   | /**         |   |         |       | |  +--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
86   | /**         |                     | |     |      |               |	     **/
87   | /**         |                     | +->+--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
88   | /**     +---+---+                 +--- | name|---+           | alias |	     **/
89   | /**     | module|                      +--+--+   |           +---+---+	     **/
90   | /**     +---+---+                         |      |               |	     **/
91   | /**         |								     **/
92   | /**			       alphabetic ordered     alphabtic ordered	     **/
93   | /**			    list of names depending    list of aliases	     **/
94   | /**			    on a single module file			     **/
95   | /**									     **/
96   | /**   Each module name points to a list of symbolic names and versions.	     **/
97   | /**   The versions themselves can be symbolic names and therefore are of the **/
98   | /**   same record type as the names.					     **/
99   | /**   The name and the version list are alphabetically sorted (even the      **/
100  | /**   module list is). A version record points to a related name record	     **/
101  | /**   containing a symbolic name for the version. Starting at this record,   **/
102  | /**   the name records build a queue of symbolic names for the version.	     **/
103  | /**   Both, the version and the name record, do have a backward pointer to   **/
104  | /**   the module record.						     **/
105  | /**									     **/
106  | /**   The alias list builds a alphabetic ordered list of defined aliases.    **/
107  | /**   Each alias record points to the related name record.		     **/
108  | /**									     **/
109  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
110  | 
111  | typedef	struct	_mod_module	{
112  |     struct _mod_module	*next;		/** alphabetic queue		     **/
113  |     struct _mod_name	*version;	/** version queue   		     **/
114  |     struct _mod_name	*name;		/** name queue      		     **/
115  |     char		*module;	/** the name itself		     **/
116  | } ModModule;
117  | 
118  | typedef	struct	_mod_name	{
119  |     struct _mod_name	*next;		/** alphabetic queue		     **/
120  |     struct _mod_name	*ptr;		/** logical next    		     **/
121  |     struct _mod_name	*version;	/** backwards version pointer	     **/
122  |     struct _mod_module	*module;	/** related module  		     **/
123  |     char		*name;		/** the name itself		     **/
124  | } ModName;
125  | 
126  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
127  | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
128  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
129  | 
130  | #define	HISTTAB	100
131  | 
132  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
133  | /**				      MACROS				     **/
134  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
135  | 
136  | /** not applicable **/
137  | 
138  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
139  | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
140  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
141  | 
142  | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
143  | 
144  | /**
145  |  **  The module and aliases list
146  |  **/
147  | 
148  | static	ModModule	*modlist = (ModModule *) NULL;
149  | static	ModName		*aliaslist = (ModName *) NULL;
150  | 
151  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
152  | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
153  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
154  | 
155  | static	void		 CleanupVersionSub(	ModModule	 *ptr);
156  | 
157  | static	void		 CleanupName(		ModName		 *ptr);
158  | 
159  | static	ModModule	*AddModule(		char		 *name);
160  | 
161  | static	ModModule	*FindModule(		char		 *name,
162  | 						ModModule	**prev);
163  | 
164  | static	ModName		*AddName(		char		 *name,
165  | 						ModName		**start,
166  | 						ModModule	 *module);
167  | 
168  | static	ModName		*FindName(		char		 *name,
169  | 						ModName		 *start,
170  | 						ModName		**prev);
171  | 
172  | static	char		*CheckModuleVersion(	char 		 *name);
173  | 
174  | static	char		*scan_versions(		char 		 *buffer,
175  | 						char		 *base,
176  | 						ModName 	 *ptr,
177  | 						ModModule 	 *modptr);
178  | 
179  | /*++++
180  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
181  |  ** 									     **
182  |  **   Function:		cmdModuleVersion				     **
183  |  ** 									     **
184  |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'version'			     **
185  |  ** 									     **
186  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
187  |  ** 									     **
188  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
189  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
190  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
191  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
192  |  ** 									     **
193  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
194  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
195  |  ** 									     **
196  |  **   Attached Globals:	modlist		List containing all version names    **
197  |  **   			g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
198  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
199  |  **					control everything		     **
200  |  ** 									     **
201  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
202  |  ++++*/
203  | 
204  | int cmdModuleVersion(
205  | 	ClientData client_data,
206  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
207  | 	int objc,
208  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
209  | ) {
210  | 	char           *version, *module;
211  | 	ModModule      *modptr;
212  | 	ModName        *versptr, *nameptr, *tmp, *ptr;
213  | 	int             i;
214  |     /**
215  |      **  Whatis mode?
216  |      **/
217  | 	if (g_flags & M_WHATIS)
218  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** ------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
219  |     /**
220  |      **  Parameter check
221  |      **/
222  | 	if (objc < 3) {
223  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
224  | 				" modulename ",
225  | 				" symbolic-version [symbolic-version ...] ",
226  | 				NULL))
227  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
228  | 	}
229  | 
230  | 	if ((char *)NULL ==
231  | 	    (module = CheckModuleVersion((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[1])))) {
232  | 		ErrorLogger(ERR_BADMODNAM, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), NULL);
233  | 		return (TCL_ERROR);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
234  | 	}
235  |     /**
236  |      **  Display mode?
237  |      **/
238  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
239  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
240  | 		for (i = 1; i < objc; i++)
241  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(objv[i]));
242  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
243  | 	}
244  |     /**
245  |      **  get the version from the argument
246  |      **/
247  | 	if ((char *)NULL == (version = strrchr(module, '/'))) {
248  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL))
249  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
250  | 	}
251  | 	*version++ = '\0';
252  |     /**
253  |      **  Now we have a module and a version.
254  |      **  Check whether it exists (cond. create them). Check both, the version
255  |      **  and the name queue in order to locate the desired version ...
256  |      **/
257  | 	if ((ModModule *) NULL == (modptr = AddModule(module))) {
258  | 		ErrorLogger(ERR_BADMODNAM, LOC,Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), NULL);
259  | 		return (TCL_ERROR);	    /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
260  | 	}
261  | 
262  | 	if ((ModName *) NULL ==
263  | 	    (ptr = FindName(version, modptr->version, &tmp))) {
264  | 		if ((ModName *) NULL ==
265  | 		    (ptr = FindName(version, modptr->name, &tmp)))
266  | 			versptr = AddName(version, &modptr->version, modptr);
267  | 		else
268  | 			versptr = ptr->version;
269  | 	} else
270  | 		versptr = ptr;
271  |     /**
272  |      **  Check all symbolic names now and allocate a name record for them
273  |      **/
274  | 	for (i = 2; i < objc; i++) {
275  | 		if (FindName(Tcl_GetString(objv[i]), modptr->name, &tmp)) {
276  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_DUP_SYMVERS, LOC,
277  | 					      Tcl_GetString(objv[i]), NULL))
278  | 				break;
279  | 			else
280  | 				continue;
281  | 		}
282  | 		if ((ModName *) NULL == (nameptr =
283  | 					 AddName((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[i]),
284  | 						 &modptr->name, modptr))) {
285  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL))
286  | 				break;
287  | 			else
288  | 				continue;
289  | 		}
290  | 	/**
291  | 	 **  Concat the new element at the beginning of the name queue ...
292  | 	 **/
293  | 		nameptr->ptr = versptr->ptr;
294  | 		versptr->ptr = nameptr;
295  | 		nameptr->version = versptr;
296  | 	}
297  | 
298  | 	return (TCL_OK);
299  | 
300  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleVersion' **/
301  | 
302  | /*++++
303  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
304  |  ** 									     **
305  |  **   Function:		ExpandVersions					     **
306  |  ** 									     **
307  |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'version'			     **
308  |  ** 									     **
309  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
310  |  ** 									     **
311  |  **   Parameters:	char	*name		Name to be expanded	     **
312  |  ** 									     **
313  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		No symbols found	     **
314  |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to the list string   **
315  |  ** 									     **
316  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
317  |  ++++*/
318  | 
319  | char	*ExpandVersions( char	*name)
320  | {
321  |     char	*version, *module, *s;
322  |     static char	 buffer[ BUFSIZ];
323  |     ModModule	*modptr, *tmp1;
324  |     ModName	*ptr, *tmp2;
325  | 
326  |     /**
327  |      **  Parameter check
328  |      **/
329  | 
330  |     if((char *) NULL == (module = CheckModuleVersion( name))) 
331  | 	return((char *) NULL );		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
332  | 
333  |     if((char *) NULL == (version = strrchr( module, '/'))) {
334  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL))
335  | 	    return((char *) NULL );	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
336  |     }
337  | 
338  |     *version++ = '\0';
339  | 
340  |     /**
341  |      **  Now we have a module and a version.
342  |      **  Check wheter it exists
343  |      **/
344  | 
345  |     if((ModModule *) NULL == (modptr = FindModule( module, &tmp1)))
346  | 	return((char *) NULL );		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
347  | 
348  |     if((ModName *) NULL == (ptr = FindName( version, modptr->version, &tmp2))) {
349  | 	if((ModName *) NULL == (ptr = FindName( version, modptr->name, &tmp2))) 
350  | 	    return((char *) NULL );	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
351  | 	ptr = ptr->version;
352  |     }
353  | 
354  |     if( !ptr->ptr)
355  | 	return((char *) NULL );		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
356  | 
357  |     /**
358  |      **  Now scan in all the symbolic version names
359  |      **/
360  |  
361  |     *buffer = '\0';
362  |     if( (s = scan_versions( buffer, buffer, ptr->ptr, modptr)) ) 
363  | 	*--s = '\0';			/** remove trailing ':'		     **/
364  | 
365  |     return( buffer);
366  | 
367  | } /** End of 'ExpandVersions' **/
368  | 
369  | /*++++
370  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
371  |  ** 									     **
372  |  **   Function:		scan_versions					     **
373  |  ** 									     **
374  |  **   Description:	Scan all symbolic versions pointed to be the passed  **
375  |  **			ModName pointer and print them as a list into the    **
376  |  **			passed buffer.					     **
377  |  ** 									     **
378  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
379  |  ** 									     **
380  |  **   Parameters:	char	*buffer		Buffer for printing in	     **
381  |  **			ModName	*ptr		Name structure pointer	     **
382  |  **			ModModule  *modptr	Assigned module name	     **
383  |  ** 									     **
384  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		Nothing printed into the     **
385  |  **						buffer			     **
386  |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to the end of the    **
387  |  **						string in the buffer	     **
388  |  ** 									     **
389  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
390  |  ++++*/
391  | 
392  | static	char	*scan_versions( char		 *buffer,
393  | 				char		 *base,
394  | 				ModName		 *ptr,
395  | 				ModModule	 *modptr)
396  | {
397  |     ModName     *tmp, *vers;
398  |     char 	*s;
399  |     char 	*mayloop;
400  | 
401  |     /**
402  |      **  Recursively print the queue of names
403  |      **/
404  | 
405  |     if( !ptr)
406  | 	return((char *) NULL);			/** ------ EXIT (END) -----> **/
407  | 
408  |     if( !ptr->name) {
409  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL))
410  | 	    return((char *) NULL);		/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
411  | 
412  |     } else {
413  | 
414  | 	/**
415  | 	 **  Prevent endless loops
416  | 	 **  To allow for version names that are substrings of other
417  | 	 **  version names, match against "(^|:)name:" not just "name"... 
418  | 	 **/
419  | 	mayloop = strstr( base, ptr->name);
420  | 	if( mayloop != NULL ) {
421  | 	    if( mayloop == base || *(mayloop-1) == ':' ) {
422  | 		if( *(mayloop + strlen(ptr->name)) == ':' ) {
423  | 	    	    ErrorLogger( ERR_SYMLOOP, LOC, ptr->name, NULL);
424  | 		    return((char *) NULL);	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
425  | 		}
426  | 	    }
427  | 	}
428  | 
429  | 	/**
430  | 	 **  Now print ...
431  | 	 **/
432  | 
433  | 	/* sprintf( buffer, "%s:", ptr->name); */
434  | 	strcpy( buffer, ptr->name);
435  | 	/* if you change this, may affect the loop checker above */
436  | 	strcat( buffer, ":");
437  | 	buffer += strlen( buffer);
438  | 
439  | 	/**
440  | 	 **  Check wheter this is a version name again ...
441  | 	 **  This is a recursion, too
442  | 	 **/
443  | 
444  | 	if((ModName *) NULL != (vers = FindName( ptr->name, modptr->version,
445  | 	    &tmp))) {
446  | 	    if( (s = scan_versions( buffer, base, vers->ptr, modptr)) )
447  | 		buffer = s;
448  | 	}
449  |     }
450  | 
451  |     /**
452  |      **  This is the recursion. Preserve the buffer end pointer
453  |      **/
454  | 
455  |     if( (s = scan_versions( buffer, base, ptr->ptr, modptr)) )
456  | 	buffer = s;
457  | 
458  |     return( buffer);
459  | 
460  | } /** End of 'scan_versions' **/
461  | 
462  | /*++++
463  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
464  |  ** 									     **
465  |  **   Function:		CheckModuleVersion				     **
466  |  ** 									     **
467  |  **   Description:	Reduce the passed module name into a <mod>/<vers>    **
468  |  **			string						     **
469  |  ** 									     **
470  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
471  |  ** 									     **
472  |  **   Parameters:	char	*name		name to be checked	     **
473  |  ** 									     **
474  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL		any error		     **
475  |  **				Otherwise	Pointer to a <mod>/<vers>    **
476  |  **						string			     **
477  |  ** 									     **
478  |  **   Attached Globals:	modlist		List containing all version names    **
479  |  **			aliaslist	List containing all alises	     **
480  |  **			g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
481  |  **						by the current command	     **
482  |  ** 									     **
483  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
484  |  ++++*/
485  | 
486  | static	char	*CheckModuleVersion( char *name)
487  | {
488  |     static char	 buffer[ BUFSIZ];
489  |     char	*s, *t;
490  | 
491  |     /**
492  |      **  Check the first parameter and extract modulename and version
493  |      **/
494  | 
495  |     if( '/' == *name) {			/** only the version specified	     **/
496  | 
497  | 	/**
498  | 	 **  get the module name from the current module ...
499  | 	 **/
500  | 
501  | 	if( !g_current_module)
502  | 	    return((char *) NULL);
503  | 
504  | 	strcpy( buffer, g_current_module);
505  | 	if((char *) NULL == (t = strrchr( buffer, '/')))
506  | 	    t = buffer + strlen( buffer);
507  | 	*t++ = '/';
508  | 	*t = '\0';
509  | 
510  | 	/**
511  | 	 **  The version has been specified as a parameter
512  | 	 **/
513  | 
514  | 	if( (s = strrchr( name, '/')) ) {
515  | 	    s++;
516  | 	} else {
517  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL);
518  | 	    return((char *) NULL);
519  | 	}
520  | 
521  | 	strcpy( t, s);
522  | 
523  |     } else {				/** Maybe an alias or a module	     **/
524  | 
525  | 	strcpy( buffer, name);
526  | 	if( !strrchr( buffer, '/')) {
527  | 
528  | 	    /**
529  | 	     **  Check wheter this is an alias ...
530  | 	     **/
531  | 
532  | 	    if( AliasLookup( buffer, &s, &t)) {
533  | 
534  | 		/* sprintf( buffer, "%s/%s", s, t); */
535  | 		strcpy( buffer, s);
536  | 		strcat( buffer, "/");
537  | 		strcat( buffer, t);
538  | 
539  | 	    } else {
540  | 
541  | 		/**
542  | 		 **  The default version is being selected
543  | 		 **/
544  | 
545  | 		t = buffer + strlen( buffer);
546  | 		if( '/' != *t)
547  | 		    *t++ = '/';
548  | 		strcpy( t, _(em_default));
549  | 	    }
550  | 	}
551  |     }
552  | 
553  |     /**
554  |      **  Pass the buffer reference to the caller
555  |      **/
556  | 
557  |     return( buffer);
558  | 
559  | } /** End of 'CheckModuleVersion' **/
560  | 
561  | /*++++
562  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
563  |  ** 									     **
564  |  **   Function:		cmdModuleAlias					     **
565  |  ** 									     **
566  |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'alias'			     **
567  |  ** 									     **
568  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
569  |  ** 									     **
570  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
571  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
572  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
573  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
574  |  ** 									     **
575  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
576  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
577  |  ** 									     **
578  |  **   Attached Globals:	aliaslist	List containing all alises	     **
579  |  **   			g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
580  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
581  |  **					control everything		     **
582  |  ** 									     **
583  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
584  |  ++++*/
585  | 
586  | int cmdModuleAlias(
587  | 	ClientData client_data,
588  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
589  | 	int objc,
590  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
591  | ) {
592  | 	ModName        *tmp, *ptr;
593  | 	char           *version, *module;
594  | 	ModName        *trg_alias;
595  | 	ModModule      *modptr;
596  | 
597  |     /**
598  |      **  Parameter check
599  |      **/
600  | 	if (objc != 3) {
601  | 		if (OK !=
602  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
603  | 				" aliasname ", "modulename", NULL))
604  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
605  | 	}
606  |     /**
607  |      **  Whatis mode?
608  |      **/
609  | 	if (g_flags & M_WHATIS)
610  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT PROCEDURE -------> **/
611  | 
612  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
613  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t %s %s\n", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
614  | 			Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), Tcl_GetString(objv[2]));
615  | 	}
616  |     /**
617  |      **  Check if the target is an alias ...
618  |      **  Conditionally split up the passed <module>/<version> pair.
619  |      **/
620  | 	trg_alias = FindName((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[2]), aliaslist, &tmp);
621  | 	if (!trg_alias) {
622  | 		if ((char *)NULL ==
623  | 		    (module = CheckModuleVersion(Tcl_GetString(objv[2]))))
624  | 			module = (char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[2]);
625  | 
626  | 		if ((char *)NULL != (version = strrchr(module, '/')))
627  | 			*version++ = '\0';
628  | 	}
629  |     /**
630  |      **  Any alias record existing with this name?
631  |      **  If it does, we're finished ...
632  |      **/
633  | 	if ((ptr = FindName((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), aliaslist, &tmp))) {
634  | 
635  | 		if (!ptr->ptr || !ptr->ptr->name ||
636  | 		    (!trg_alias
637  | 		     && (!ptr->ptr->module || !ptr->ptr->module->module))) {
638  | 			ErrorLogger(ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL);
639  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
640  | 		}
641  | 
642  | 		if((trg_alias && !strcmp(ptr->ptr->name,Tcl_GetString(objv[2])))
643  | 		    || (!trg_alias && !strcmp(ptr->ptr->name, version)
644  | 			&& !strcmp(ptr->ptr->module->module, module)))
645  | 			return (TCL_OK);/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
646  | 
647  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_DUP_ALIAS,LOC,Tcl_GetString(objv[1]),
648  | 				NULL))
649  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
650  | 	} else {
651  | 	/**
652  | 	 **  We have to allocate a new alias entry
653  | 	 **/
654  | 		if ((ModName *) NULL ==
655  | 		    (ptr = AddName((char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[1]), &aliaslist,
656  | 			     NULL))) {
657  | 			ErrorLogger(ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL);
658  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
659  | 		}
660  | 	}
661  |     /**
662  |      **  Now ptr points to the affected module alias record ...
663  |      **  Conditionally we have to create the module and the version record now.
664  |      **/
665  | 	if (trg_alias) {
666  | 		ptr->ptr = trg_alias;
667  | 	} else {
668  | 		if ((ModModule *) NULL == (modptr = AddModule(module))) {
669  | 			ErrorLogger(ERR_BADMODNAM, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[2]),
670  | 				    NULL);
671  | 			ptr->ptr = (ModName *) NULL;
672  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
673  | 		}
674  | 		ptr->ptr = AddName((version ? version : _(em_default)),
675  | 				   &modptr->version, modptr);
676  | 	}
677  | 
678  | 	return (TCL_OK);
679  | 
680  | } /** End of 'cmdModuleAlias' **/
681  | 
682  | /*++++
683  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
684  |  ** 									     **
685  |  **   Function:		AliasLookup					     **
686  |  ** 									     **
687  |  **   Description:	Resolves a given alias to a module/version string    **
688  |  ** 									     **
689  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
690  |  ** 									     **
691  |  **   Parameters:	char	*alias		Name of the alias to be re-  **
692  |  **						solved			     **
693  |  **			char	**module	Buffer for the module name   **
694  |  **			char	**version	Buffer for the module version**
695  |  ** 									     **
696  |  **   Result:		int	1		Success, value in the buffer **
697  |  **						is valid		     **
698  |  **				0		Any error, or not found	     **
699  |  ** 									     **
700  |  **   Attached Globals:	aliaslist	List containing all alises	     **
701  |  ** 									     **
702  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
703  |  ++++*/
704  | 
705  | int	AliasLookup(	char	*alias,
706  | 			char	**module,
707  | 			char	**version)
708  | {
709  |     ModName	*ptr, *tmp, *oldptr = NULL;
710  | 
711  |     while( 1) {
712  | 
713  | 	/**
714  | 	 **  Lokate the alias entry and check intergrity
715  | 	 **/
716  | 
717  | 	if((ModName *) NULL == (ptr = FindName( alias, aliaslist, &tmp)))
718  | 	    return( 0);			/** ------- EXIT (not found) ------> **/
719  | 
720  | 	if( ptr == oldptr || !ptr->ptr || !ptr->ptr->name ) {
721  | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL);
722  | 	    return( 0);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
723  | 	}
724  | 
725  | 	/**
726  | 	 **  Do we have to loop? Another alias has no module reference ...
727  | 	 **/
728  | 
729  |         if( !ptr->ptr->module) {
730  | 	    alias = ptr->ptr->name;
731  | 	    oldptr = ptr;
732  | 	    continue;
733  | 	}
734  | 
735  | 	/**
736  | 	 **  Got it. Get the module name and the version from the found
737  | 	 **  entry.
738  | 	 **  Dereference symbolic module versions
739  | 	 **/
740  | 
741  | 	*module = ptr->ptr->module->module;
742  | 	*version = ptr->ptr->name;
743  | 
744  | 	if((ModName *) NULL != (ptr = FindName( *version,
745  | 	    ptr->ptr->module->name, &tmp))) {
746  | 	    if( !ptr->version || !ptr->version->name) {
747  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL))
748  | 		    return( 0);
749  | 	    } else 
750  | 		*version = ptr->version->name;
751  | 	}
752  | 
753  | 	break;
754  | 
755  |     } /** while **/
756  | 
757  |     return( 1);
758  | 
759  | } /** End of 'AliasLookup' **/
760  | 
761  | /*++++
762  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
763  |  ** 									     **
764  |  **   Function:		VersionLookup					     **
765  |  ** 									     **
766  |  **   Description:	Resolves a given alias to a module/version string    **
767  |  ** 									     **
768  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
769  |  ** 									     **
770  |  **   Parameters:	char	*alias		Name of the alias to be re-  **
771  |  **						solved			     **
772  |  **			char	**module	Buffer for the module name   **
773  |  **			char	**version	Buffer for the module version**
774  |  ** 									     **
775  |  **   Result:		int	1		Success, value in the buffer **
776  |  **						is valid		     **
777  |  **				0		Any error, or not found	     **
778  | 
779  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
780  |  **						by the current command	     **
781  |  ** 									     **
782  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
783  |  ++++*/
784  | 
785  | int	VersionLookup(	char *name, char **module, char **version)
786  | {
787  |     static char  buffer[ BUFSIZ];
788  |     ModModule	*mptr, *mtmp;
789  |     ModName	*vptr, *vtmp;
790  |     ModName	**history;
791  |     char	*s, *t;
792  |     int		 histsize = 0, histndx = 0, i;
793  | 
794  |     /**
795  |      **  Check whether this is an alias ...
796  |      **  BTW: Alias lookups return the FQMN (full qualifed module name ;-)
797  |      **/
798  | 
799  |     if( '/' == *name) {
800  | 	strcpy( buffer, g_current_module);
801  | 	if( (s = strrchr( buffer, '/')) )
802  | 	    *s = '\0';
803  | 	*module = buffer;
804  | 	*version = name + 1;
805  |     
806  |     } else {
807  | 
808  | 	strcpy( buffer, name);
809  | 	*module = buffer;
810  | 
811  | 	if((char *) NULL == (*version = strrchr( buffer, '/'))) {
812  | 
813  | 	    if( AliasLookup( buffer, &s, &t)) {
814  | 		*module = s; *version = t;
815  | 
816  | 	    } else
817  | 		*version = _(em_default);
818  | 
819  | 	} else 
820  | 	    *(*version)++ = '\0';
821  |     }
822  | 
823  |     /**
824  |      **  Look up modulename ...
825  |      **  We call it success, if we do not find a registered name.
826  |      **  In this case <module>/<version> will be returned as passed.
827  |      **/
828  |     if((ModModule *) NULL == (mptr = FindModule( *module, &mtmp))) {
829  | 	return( 1);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
830  |     }
831  | 
832  |     /**
833  |      **  This is for preventing from endless loops
834  |      **/
835  |     histsize = HISTTAB;
836  |     histndx = 0;
837  | 
838  |     if((ModName **) NULL == (history = (ModName **) module_malloc( histsize * 
839  | 	sizeof( ModName *)))) {
840  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
841  | 	return( 0);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
842  |     }
843  | 
844  |     /**
845  |      **  Now look up the version name. Check symbolic names first. If some-
846  |      **  thing is found, check if the related version record itself relates
847  |      **  to a name record ...
848  |      **/
849  |     while( 1) {
850  | 
851  | 	/**
852  | 	 **  Check the symbolic names ...
853  | 	 **/
854  | 	if((ModName *) NULL != (vptr = FindName( *version, mptr->name, &vtmp))){
855  | 	    if( !vptr->version || !vptr->version->name) {
856  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_INTERAL, LOC, NULL)) 
857  | 		    *version = (char *) NULL;
858  | 		break;
859  | 	    }
860  | 
861  | 	    *version = vptr->version->name;
862  | 
863  | 	    /**
864  | 	     **  Prevent from looping ...
865  | 	     **/
866  | 	    for( i=0; i<histndx; i++) {
867  | 		if( history[ i] == vptr) {		/** That's the loop  **/
868  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_SYMLOOP, LOC, *version, NULL);
869  | 		    *version = (char *) NULL;
870  | 		    break;
871  | 		}
872  | 	    }
873  | 
874  | 	    if( !*version)
875  | 		break;
876  | 
877  | 	    if( histndx >= histsize) {
878  | 		histsize += HISTTAB;
879  | 
880  | 		if((ModName **) NULL == (history = (ModName **) module_realloc(
881  | 		    history, histsize * sizeof( ModName *)))) {
882  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
883  | 		    return( 0);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
884  | 		}
885  | 	    }
886  | 
887  | 	    history[ histndx++] = vptr;
888  | 
889  | 	} else {
890  | 	    break;
891  | 
892  | 	} /** if( FindName) **/
893  |     } /** while( 1) **/
894  | 
895  |     /**
896  |      **  Free the loop preventing list
897  |      **  If version is NULL now, something went wrong in the lookup loop above
898  |      **/
899  |     null_free((void *) &history);
900  |     return((char *) NULL != *version);
901  | 
902  | } /** End of 'VersionLookup' **/
903  | 
904  | /*++++
905  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
906  |  ** 									     **
907  |  **   Function:		CleanupVersion					     **
908  |  ** 									     **
909  |  **   Description:	Cleanup the version structure			     **
910  |  ** 									     **
911  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
912  |  ** 									     **
913  |  **   Parameters:	-						     **
914  |  ** 									     **
915  |  **   Result:		-						     **
916  |  ** 									     **
917  |  **   Attached Globals:	modlist		List containing all version names    **
918  |  **			aliaslist	List containing all alises	     **
919  |  ** 									     **
920  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
921  |  ++++*/
922  | 
923  | void	CleanupVersion(ModModule *ptr)
924  | {
925  | 
926  |     CleanupVersionSub( modlist);
927  |     modlist = (ModModule *) NULL;
928  | 
929  |     CleanupName( aliaslist);
930  |     aliaslist = (ModName *) NULL;
931  | 
932  | } /** End of 'CleanupVersion' **/
933  | 
934  | static void	CleanupVersionSub( ModModule *ptr)
935  | {
936  |     /**
937  |      **  Recursion
938  |      **/
939  | 
940  |     if( !ptr)
941  | 	return;
942  | 
943  |     CleanupVersion( ptr->next);
944  | 
945  |     /**
946  |      **  Cleanup everything that relates to this record
947  |      **/
948  | 
949  |     CleanupName( ptr->version);
950  |     CleanupName( ptr->name);
951  |     null_free((void *) &(ptr->module));
952  | 
953  | } /** End of 'CleanupVersionSub' **/
954  | 
955  | static void	CleanupName( ModName *ptr)
956  | {
957  |     /**
958  |      **  Recursion
959  |      **/
960  | 
961  |     if( !ptr)
962  | 	return;
963  | 
964  |     CleanupName( ptr->next);
965  | 
966  |     /**
967  |      **  Cleanup everything that relates to this record
968  |      **/
969  | 
970  |     null_free((void *) &(ptr->name));
971  | 
972  | } /** End of 'CleanupName' **/
973  | 
974  | /*++++
975  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
976  |  ** 									     **
977  |  **   Function:		AddModule					     **
978  |  ** 									     **
979  |  **   Description:	Add a new entry to the modules queue		     **
980  |  ** 									     **
981  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
982  |  ** 									     **
983  |  **   Parameters:	char	*name		Name of the new module	     **
984  |  ** 									     **
985  |  **   Result:		ModModule*	NULL	Any error                    **
986  |  **					Else	Pointer to the new record    **
987  |  ** 									     **
988  |  **   Attached Globals:	modlist		List containing all version names    **
989  |  ** 									     **
990  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
991  |  ++++*/
992  | 
993  | static	ModModule	*AddModule(	char	*name)
994  | {
995  |     ModModule	*app_ptr, *ptr;
996  | 
997  |     /**
998  |      **  We do not trust in NULL module names
999  |      **/
1000 |     if( !name || !*name)
1001 | 	return((ModModule *) NULL);
1002 |     /**
1003 |      **  Check if the module name already exists and save the 'prev' pointer
1004 |      **  for appending the new one.
1005 |      **/
1006 |     if( (ptr = FindModule( name, &app_ptr)) )
1007 | 	return( ptr);
1008 | 
1009 |     /**
1010 |      **  Allocate a new guy
1011 |      **/
1012 | 
1013 |     if((ModModule *) NULL ==
1014 | 		(ptr = (ModModule *) module_malloc( sizeof(ModModule)))) {
1015 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1016 | 	return((ModModule *) NULL);
1017 |     }
1018 | 
1019 |     /**
1020 |      **  Fill the name in and put it in the queue
1021 |      **/
1022 | 
1023 |     if((char *) NULL == (ptr->module = stringer(NULL,0, name, NULL))) {
1024 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1025 | 	null_free((void *) &ptr);
1026 | 	return((ModModule *) NULL);
1027 |     }
1028 | 
1029 |     if( app_ptr) {
1030 | 	ptr->next = app_ptr->next;
1031 | 	app_ptr->next = ptr;
1032 |     } else {
1033 | 	ptr->next = modlist;
1034 | 	modlist = ptr;
1035 |     }
1036 | 
1037 |     ptr->version = (ModName *) NULL;
1038 |     ptr->name = (ModName *) NULL;
1039 | 
1040 |     /**
1041 |      **  Pass back the pointer to the new entry
1042 |      **/
1043 | 
1044 |     return( ptr);
1045 | 
1046 | } /** End of 'AddModule' **/
1047 | 
1048 | /*++++
1049 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1050 |  ** 									     **
1051 |  **   Function:		FindModule					     **
1052 |  ** 									     **
1053 |  **   Description:	Find a new entry in the modules queue		     **
1054 |  ** 									     **
1055 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
1056 |  ** 									     **
1057 |  **   Parameters:	char		*name	Name of be found	     **
1058 |  **			ModModule	**prev	Buffer for the 'previous'    **
1059 |  **						pointer			     **
1060 |  ** 									     **
1061 |  **   Result:		ModModule*	NULL	Any error or not found       **
1062 |  **					Else	Pointer to the record	     **
1063 |  ** 									     **
1064 |  **   Attached Globals:	modlist		List containing all version names    **
1065 |  ** 									     **
1066 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1067 |  ++++*/
1068 | 
1069 | static	ModModule	*FindModule(	char		 *name,
1070 | 					ModModule	**prev)
1071 | {
1072 |     ModModule	*ptr = modlist;
1073 |     int		 cmp = 1;
1074 | 
1075 |     *prev = (ModModule *) NULL;
1076 |     while( ptr && 0 < (cmp = strcmp( name, ptr->module))) {
1077 | 	*prev = ptr;
1078 | 	ptr = ptr->next;
1079 |     }
1080 | 
1081 |     return( cmp ? (ModModule *) NULL : ptr);
1082 | 
1083 | } /** End of 'FindModule' **/
1084 | 
1085 | /*++++
1086 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1087 |  ** 									     **
1088 |  **   Function:		AddName						     **
1089 |  ** 									     **
1090 |  **   Description:	Add a new entry to the name queue		     **
1091 |  ** 									     **
1092 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
1093 |  ** 									     **
1094 |  **   Parameters:	char	 *name		Name of the new entry	     **
1095 |  **			ModName	**start		Start of the queue	     **
1096 |  **			ModModule *module	Parent module record pointer **
1097 |  ** 									     **
1098 |  **   Result:		ModName*	NULL	Any error                    **
1099 |  **					Else	Pointer to the new record    **
1100 |  ** 									     **
1101 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1102 |  ++++*/
1103 | 
1104 | static	ModName	*AddName(	char	 *name,
1105 | 				ModName	**start,
1106 | 				ModModule *module)
1107 | {
1108 |     ModName	*app_ptr, *ptr;
1109 | 
1110 |     /**
1111 |      **  Check if the name already exists and save the 'prev' pointer
1112 |      **  for appending the new one.
1113 |      **/
1114 | 
1115 |     if( (ptr = FindName( name, *start, &app_ptr)) )
1116 | 	return( ptr);
1117 | 
1118 |     /**
1119 |      **  Allocate a new guy
1120 |      **/
1121 | 
1122 |     if((ModName *) NULL == (ptr = (ModName *) module_malloc(sizeof(ModName)))) {
1123 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1124 | 	return((ModName *) NULL);
1125 |     }
1126 | 
1127 |     /**
1128 |      **  Fill the name in and put it in the queue
1129 |      **/
1130 | 
1131 |     if((char *) NULL == (ptr->name = stringer(NULL,0, name, NULL))) {
1132 | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1133 | 	null_free((void *) &ptr);
1134 | 	return((ModName *) NULL);
1135 |     }
1136 | 
1137 |     if( app_ptr) {
1138 | 	ptr->next = app_ptr->next;
1139 | 	app_ptr->next = ptr;
1140 |     } else {
1141 | 	ptr->next = *start;
1142 | 	*start = ptr;
1143 |     }
1144 | 
1145 |     ptr->module = module;
1146 |     ptr->version = ptr->ptr = (ModName *) NULL;
1147 | 
1148 |     /**
1149 |      **  Pass back the pointer to the new entry
1150 |      **/
1151 | 
1152 |     return( ptr);
1153 | 
1154 | } /** End of 'AddName' **/
1155 | 
1156 | /*++++
1157 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1158 |  ** 									     **
1159 |  **   Function:		FindName					     **
1160 |  ** 									     **
1161 |  **   Description:	Find a new entry in the modules queue		     **
1162 |  ** 									     **
1163 |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/28					     **
1164 |  ** 									     **
1165 |  **   Parameters:	char	 *name		Name of be found	     **
1166 |  **			ModName  *start		Start of the name queue      **
1167 |  **			ModName	**prev		Buffer for the 'previous'    **
1168 |  **						pointer			     **
1169 |  ** 									     **
1170 |  **   Result:		ModName*	NULL	Any error or not found       **
1171 |  **					Else	Pointer to the record	     **
1172 |  ** 									     **
1173 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1174 |  ++++*/
1175 | 
1176 | static	ModName	*FindName(	char	 *name,
1177 | 				ModName  *start,
1178 | 				ModName	**prev)
1179 | {
1180 |     ModName	*ptr = start;
1181 |     int		 cmp = 1;
1182 | 
1183 |     *prev = (ModName *) NULL;
1184 |     while( ptr && 0 < (cmp = strcmp( name, ptr->name))) {
1185 | 	*prev = ptr;
1186 | 	ptr = ptr->next;
1187 |     }
1188 | 
1189 |     return( cmp ? (ModName *) NULL : ptr);
1190 | 
1191 | } /** End of 'FindName' **/
